reviews.review_msg: Just wanted to post here to let readers know that Marela has passed away in 2021, please dont take this page down. She was an amazing professor and the kind words of her students deserved to be recorded on the internet.

Marela is like a friend morso than a prof. She is super kind and will discuss how the lecture material correlates to our everyday lives. Half the time you end up having deep discussions. Participation is important and highly encouraged. If you want a chill/vibey class, she is amazing. I took the class synchronously online.

Marela is one of the nicest professors you will ever have at SFU. Her 3-hour seminars can seem to drag on as she will talk about nothing for a while, but she is so nice and caring. She really cares about her students and seems like such a real person.

Marela has a passion for her field, and her style of teaching reflects it. She teaches based on the needs of the students, and every class is different. There's more than enough time to do assignments, and due dates are flexible. She'll review your papers and give feedback up until the due date. Her marking is fair as long as you put in the work.

she is a nice lady, but her lecture is so boring and seems like she does not even know what to teach since we have been taught so abstract topics. Her lecture is dry and long, learned nothing valuable...

pls hole punch your hand outs thats all i ask!!! also she is a nice lady and all but as a teacher she is a lil awkward, always asking the class questions and no one wants to answer cuz we havent been taught yet/irrelevant questions.

Marela was great. I'm not sure what all the complaints are about, but ignore them - she is remarkably understanding and willing to help, but you have to ask for it and put in a healthy amount of effort. Seriously committed to  her job.

Excellent Prof. Really tries to engage students in the dialogues and discourses that are taking place around them. Really tries to develop the reflective practitioner in her students by asking fundamental questions:Who am I? Who am I in Context? Group project was a really great way to be critical about things and ponder on what they have to offer.

Avoid her  I wanted her to check my paragraph, she doesn't even read them all, then say whole bunch of problems in the paragraph. She never likes anything other than her work. By the way, the paragraph was written by a TA as an example.
Dichupa is defintely a nice lady. She is willing to help at all time, even at her leisure time. hmmm she is just okay
This is the worst prof I have ever had.  If you have a chance take that class with a different prof.  She doesn't help you with your assignments and then give you a bad grade.
not bad and definitely ask for help when needed and talk!
The worst prof I have ever met. You will learn nothing in this courses because she will never help you and give you any valuable advice. You just end up with poor grades

The worst prof I have ever met. Whatever you ask, she just said you should figure out it by yourself. And you will never know what is wrong with your work, and just end up with poor grades. She is so mean and not helpful at all. I will never take her courses any more.

Marela is such an awesome prof! The class is easy. It involves group project, easy group assignments, NO TESTS, and a final essay, and easy group project. It's an easy go fun Education class based on reflective practice

Nice lady but this class is really pointless. Did not learn anything and I was never interested at any point in the four hour class. She's an easy marker and the assignments aren't hard but its boring

She was 1 of the most understanding and helpful professors I have ever had at SFU over the last 6 yrs, She tries hard to make everyone interested and hence she is always available for extra help. She goes out of her way to be helpful and fair to her students; open minded regarding her teaching so everyone can be engaged which is great fair grading

This class was very mixed. She was super nice but you learn nothing. It was a class on diversity and I ended up with a great grade, but actually being more prejudice and completely unaware of practical ways to promote diversity in a class. She also doesn't teach to "educators" because so many other majors are in the class.
Took Falx99 in Spring 2011!  She was pretty easy in marking our assignments and was quite lenient in accepting late assignments.  If she were to teach another class, I would take it with her!
